newsitem.title: USA: Exel to acquire GCR for $637 million.
newsitem.headline: Exel to acquire GCR for $637 million.

text.p: Exel Ltd. said Thursday it agreed to acquire the publicly held shares of reinsurer GCR Holdings Ltd. that it does not already own for about $637 million, or $27 a share in cash.
The deal, the latest in the industry, came a day after life insurer Unitrin Inc. said it would buy Reliable Life Insurance Co..

"The entire industry is in the midst of a consolidation," said Cathy Seifert, an analyst at the S&P Equity Group. "I think if you look at the list of insurance companies out there a year from now, there will be fewer smaller insurance companies."
Exel said it will start a cash tender offer for the 23.6 million outstanding GCR shares no later than May 14. It now owns 1.2 million, or 4.9 percent, of GCR's 24.8 million shares outstanding.
The offer has been unanimously approved by both companies' boards directors and is subject to the tender of at least 75 percent of GCR's shares.
Exel said the merger of the two companies should boost 1997 earnings and increase shareholder value.
GCR's stock shot up $4.875 to $27.25 on Nasdaq. Exel rose $3.75 to $43.375 on the New York Stock Exchange, indicating that investors thought the company got a bargain.
"I liked what I saw," said Merrill Lynch analyst Jay Cohen. He upgraded Exel from "accumulate" to "buy" and raised his 12-month price target for the stock to $51 to $53.
Analysts expect Exel to make further acquisitions as the deal leaves it with about $250 million in excess capital in a rapidly consolidating insurance industry.

"After the deal we'll still have enough capital to do an acquisition or a buyback," said EXEL spokesman Gavin Arton. "But it will slow our buyback plan for this year, and we certainly wouldn't do a buyback in the next few months."
Arton said Exel would consider a company that provides risk-management products, such as currency risk coverage. But so far, "there's nothing we've targeted," he said.

Exel, based in Bermuda, is a leading provider of general liability, directors' and officers' liability, employment practices and professional liability, excess property insurance and reinsurance worldwide.
GCR, also based in Bermuda, provides property, marine, energy, satellite and financial products reinsurance worldwide through its Global Capital Reinsurance Ltd. subsidiary.
